medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe short stature caused by novel compound heterozygous mutations of the Insulin-Like Growth Factor 1 Receptor (IGF1R).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Intrauterine growth retardation (IUGR) was detected at 33 weeks gestation. At age 3.4 years, the patient had a height of 72.2 cm and weight of 6.9 kg, indicating significant growth failure. Throughout his childhood, height was consistently below normal, with a final height of 133.2 cm at age 20.3 years.
medical_history.past_medical_history: A diagnosis of antibody-negative insulin-requiring diabetes was made at age 14 years. Additionally, there was a history of mild global developmental delay, and central adiposity and lumbar lordosis were noted as an adult.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's deceased sister was also severely short statured and had a history of Burkitt's lymphoma. Their mother had insulin-requiring gestational diabetes, and maternal grandmother had adult-onset diabetes.
